ai.summary: Lade Braes Walk is a 10.8 km moderate hike in the UK that threads along a scenic riverside and through woodland. The route features mixed terrain, including paved paths, gravel tracks, boardwalk sections, and some staircases, with occasional elevation changes and water views. Suitable for most walkers with moderate effort.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail uses a mix of surfaces: urban pavements, gravel paths, wooden boardwalks, and stair sections. Expect some uneven ground and occasional mud after rain. The route runs along the Lade Burn with short, gentle ascents and descents; parts are shaded by trees while others are exposed.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go; UK conditions can change quickly. Wear sturdy footwear and be prepared for muddy sections or slippery stairs. The route is shared with cyclists in some sections, so keep to the side and watch for oncoming riders. Bring a map or downloaded navigation and tell someone your plan; carry water and a small first-aid kit. Dogs should be under control on busy sections.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking shoes or boots with good grip
Sun protection (hat, sunscreen) and sunglasses; rain protection
Mobile phone with offline maps; portable charger
Map or GPS device (or fully charged phone with navigation app)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (Aprilâ€“October) typically offers the best conditions with milder weather and better visibility. The walk can be done in winter with proper clothing and footwear, but expect mud and colder winds.

seo.meta_description: Explore Lade Braes Walk, a 10.8 km moderate hike in the UK. Learn terrain, safety tips, gear recommendations, and the best seasons to enjoy this scenic riverside route.
